$!

There’s no charge to take the compulsory basic training (CBT) and direct access scheme (DAS) instructor assessments, but there are fees for other types of motorcycle trainer tests and registration.

$!

##Driving Standards Agency (DSA) special test fee

As a fully qualified motorcycle trainer you can take the DSA special test if you want your skills tested to the highest standard.

Fee type | Price
- | -
DSA motorcycle special test | £163


##Register of post-test motorcycle trainers (RPMT) fees

You have to pay a fee to take the qualifying tests and then register to join the RPMT so you can give [enhanced rider scheme](enhanced-rider-scheme/overview "Enhanced rider scheme") training. 

Fee type | Price
- | -
Starter pack | £6.99
Theory and hazard perception test | £66
Riding ability test | £114
Instructional ability test | £114
Registration and renewal fee (1 year) | £90
Registration and renewal fee (4 years) | £240

^ You have to pay the full amount again if you don’t pass any of the tests, and want to take another one.^

^ There are different [fees for motorcycle trainers](http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/index/information-and-services/motoring/driving-for-a-living/how-do-i-become-an-approved-motorcycle-instructor-ami.htm "Fees for motorcycle trainers"){:rel="external"} in Northern Ireland. ^

*[CBT]: Compulsory basic training
*[DAS]: Direct access scheme
*[DSA]: Driving Standards Agency
*[RPMT]: Register of post-test motorcycle trainers
overview: Fees for becoming one of the different types a motorcycle trainer and registering with the Driving Standards Agency (DSA)
title: Motorcycle trainer fees
